post_text: Miller High School Student Council will be hosting a dodgeball tournament in order to raise money for Student Council. The dodgeball tournament will be held on November 26th at 6pm. This tournament will be open for the students and staff, along with the public to play. Teams can consist of six players of any age. The cost is $5 per player, making it $30 a team. There will also be a $2 admission fee to come watch. Teams can create their own uniforms. There will be a prize for the winning team of the tournament, and the team with the most creative uniforms. November 20th will be the last day to enter before it counts as a late entry. November 21st through 24th will be late entry, and will result in an additional $5 per team. This event will take place in the middle school gym. There will be food and drinks available for purchase in the concession stand. Everyone is invited to participate or watch!

post_text: 10th Grade US History students from Miller High School got a first-hand opportunity to learn local history in New Straitsville and Shawnee today. The first stop was the New Straitsville History Museum where the students learned what "making ends meet" was like for coal mining families. Then the group traveled to Shawnee where local historian Rob Dishon shared with the students some of the local history of Shawnee and the Tecumseh Theater. Thanks to the New Straitsville History Group and Rob for helping our students learn about their rich local history.

Pictured are Miller FFA Vice President Taylor Hinkle, Miller FFA Treasurer Alaina Boyden, and Perry County Farm Bureau Vice President, Rich Maxwell.
Thanks to the Perry County Farm Bureau, the Miller FFA and other FFA Chapters in the Perry County who were part of a "Farm To Table" Fundraiser and Auction. The FFA members helped serve, prepare, and coordinate this event along with donating auction items to bid on. Thanks to this great event, each Chapter was able to receive a very generous donation towards their travel, student needs, and other expenses for their school's FFA program throughout the year.
The Miller FFA would like to give a huge thank you to Perry County Farm Bureau for coordinating this event and allowing them to be part of it. We look forward to an even better event next year!
